intro: Dipsacella setigera, commonly known as the slender wood sage, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in woodland and scrub habitats, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Dipsacella setigera is often found in moist, calcareous soils and can be a valuable component of biodiversity-rich ecosystems.
